item.title: Tracheostomy
item.description: Surgical Anatomy of Tracheostomy: A Detailed Exploration # Tracheostomy, a surgical procedure involving the creation of an opening into the trachea through the neck, is a critical intervention in various medical contexts, from emergency airway management to long-term ventilation support. Understanding the intricate anatomy of the neck and the layered dissection involved is paramount for safe and effective tracheostomy placement. Anatomical Considerations # 1. Surface Anatomy: Tracheostomy is typically performed between the second and fourth tracheal rings, corresponding to the level of the cricoid cartilage (C6 vertebrae level).
